profileText: (Uncle of Samuel Barrett Pettengill), a Delegate from the Territory of Montana; born in Upper Marlboro, Prince George's County, Md., September 21, 1838; moved with his father to Keokuk, Iowa, in 1850; attended the public schools; studied law in Keokuk and at the law school in Albany, N.Y.; was admitted to the bar in 1858 and commenced practice in Keokuk; moved to Carson City, Nev., in 1861 and Humboldt, Nev., in 1862 and continued the practice of law; member of the Territorial house of representatives in 1862 and 1863 and of the State house of representatives in 1864 and 1865; practiced law in Virginia City, Nev., Helena, Mont., and Deer Lodge, Mont.; elected as a Republican a Delegate from Montana to the Forty-second Congress (March 4, 1871-March 3, 1873); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1872 to the Forty-third Congress; resumed the practice of law in Deer Lodge, Mont., Denver, Colo., Deadwood, Dakota Territory, Portland, Oreg., and Coeur d'alene, Idaho; president of the constitutional convention of Idaho in 1889; unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States Senate from Idaho in 1891 and again in 1895; moved to Spokane, Wash., resumed the practice of law, and died there August 3, 1901; interment in Greenwood Cemetery.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Clagett, William Horace. Money, banks, panics, and prosperity. [Washington, D.C.: Cromwell Bros., 1898].
------. Territorial courts. Speech of Hon. William H. Clagett, of Montana, in the House of Representatives, March 16, 1872. [Washington: Printed at the Congressional Globe Office, 1872].

researchRecord.name: In the William R. Marshall Papers, 1853-1894, 1 cubic foot.
researchRecord.description: The papers contain a letter from W. H. Clagett to William Marshall concerning Yellowstone National Park (July 14, 1894).

researchRecord.name: 1872, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: The letter, written by William Clagett and addressed from Washington, D.C., is to Seth Bullock in Helena and discusses the introduction of a bill to establish an assay office in Helena, and other political news.

researchRecord.name: ca. 1872-1894, 0.1 linear foot.
researchRecord.description: The William Clagett Collection includes four letters (1872) to Robert E. Fisk concerning Helena Herald business and his work in Congress; and photocopies of four letters (1894) concerning the founding of Yellowstone National Park, including two with the Minnesota Historical Society and two with Nathaniel P. Langford.
